title: FUFA Women Super League : Kampala Queens , Wakiso Hill face off in season opener
body_text:
Finance Trust Bank FUFA Women Super League
Matchday One
Friday, 27th September 2024
Kampala Queens FC vs Wakiso Hill WFC
MTN-Omondi Stadium
Kickoff: 3PM
The 2024/25 Finance Trust Bank FUFA Women Super League season will officially commence on Friday with Kampala Queens hosting Wakiso Hill at MTN-Omondi Stadium.
The new season comes with changes including change of name due to the arrival of Finance Trust Bank as the first ever sponsor in women’s football in Uganda.
The Bank will inject 2 billion shillings into women football for the next five years, covering both the first and second divisions.
The other change in the new season is the increase in number of teams from ten to twelve.
Kampala Queens who are title favorites will hope to begin the quest for the League crown on a high against visiting Wakiso Hill.
Under the stewardship of coach Charles Ayiekoh, Kampala Queens has made several signings to bolster their squad.
Zaitun Namaganda and Moureen Kimono have been signed from Wakiso Hill while Kamiyati Naigaga, Shamusa Najjuma and Sumaya Nalumu are some of the new additions to the team.
Wakiso Hill on the other hand look depleted and will hugely rely on the ability of their coach Rogers Nkugwa who has been around women’s football for quite some time.
Matchday one action will continue on Saturday with Lady Doves hosting FC Tooro Queens, newly promoted Olila High School and Amus College will face off in the Teso derby while She Corporate will take on Uganda Martyrs High School.
On Sunday, Makerere University will host She Maroons while defending Champions Kawempe Muslim will face Rines SS.
